sect1.title: Implicitly Qualified Target
sect1.para:
A target may also have the simple form
region_name
The name of a region.
This is shorthand for either an instance target, this:region_name, or a class target type_name:region_name, where type_name is the class in which region_name is declared, depending on whether the region named by region_name is an instance or a static region, respectively.

formalpara.title: If named region is non-static, then the annotation must be on a non-static method
formalpara.para: Methods that are static don't have a receiver. Constructors mask their effects on the receiver, so there is no point in declaring them

formalpara.title: The region identified by region_name must be declared in the annotated class or one of its ancestors.
